title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 340.1 - Application to practice podiatry or for rerating
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 340.1 - Application to practice podiatry or for rerating

State Regulations

Application by a duly licensed podiatrist of the State of

New York to practice or for rerating under the Workers' Compensation Law shall
be made upon a form furnished by the chair which shall be filed with the

Podiatry Practice Committee, Health Provider Administration, 100

Broadway-Menands, Albany, NY 12241. Such application shall state, fully and
truthfully, all the information required by law and the applicant shall make
and sign the statutory agreement. The chair will notify the podiatrist of
approval of his or her application within 60 days after receipt by the chair of
a recommendation for approval from the Podiatry Practice

Committee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
340.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
